Pre-Game Insights: Golden State Warriors (17-16, ninth in the Western Conference) host Memphis Grizzlies (23-11, second in the Western Conference) in a Western Conference matchup.
Warriors are 13-12 against Western Conference opponents, scoring 112.3 points per game while outscoring opponents by 1.9 points per game.
Grizzlies are 10-9 in conference play, leading the NBA with 12.9 offensive rebounds per game, averaging 127.0 points per game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Stephen Curry is shooting 44.7% and averaging 22.3 points for the Warriors.
Santi Aldama is averaging 13 points and 7.3 rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Warriors are shooting 44.8% from the field, while Grizzlies allow 44.4% to opponents.
Grizzlies average 14.3 made 3-pointers per game, while Warriors give up 13.2 per game.
Others: Key players include Stephen Curry and Santi Aldama.

Injuries: Warriors have Stephen Curry out (knee), Andrew Wiggins day-to-day (hamstring), Brandin Podziemski out (abdominal), Gary Payton II out (calf). Grizzlies have Marcus Smart out (finger), Santi Aldama out (ankle), Yuki Kawamura day-to-day (shoulder), Vince Williams Jr. out (ankle), Ja Morant out (ac joint), GG Jackson II out (foot).
